column5:
24 hours have passed since I wrote back to the uni in question asking about fees for the work they were requesting.  

No response.

So I wrote this: https://t.co/fREKNtqmss

@antronicsltd @solomania @katebevan Absolutely. But I think we have to be careful not to swing too far from "it's AI!" to "it's pointless!" 

It doesn't have to be smart or perfect to be important. As I point out (in a roundabout way) here: https://t.co/vEXA9w0ZY0
I am shamelessly thieving "spicy autocomplete"
@obscureenough Well, she's only human. Hard to resist.

@editor_Maguire @Northern_Spin1 @MarpleLeaf @LeeAndersonMP_ @IanLaveryMP @AngelaRayner @LiamThorpECHO @JenWilliams_FT Question 1 can only be answered with language of which you would not approve Chris.

@TMGB It's really caught me. Listened to Buhloone Mindstate in the cassette deck in my first car. And Fallin' with Teenage Fanclub must be one of my most played songs ever. Loved The First Serve album more recently - rinsed that so much that my Spotify feed became basically De La.
@jonobacon Ah just caught the top of your sheet. My GCSEs were pretty decent but was utterly bored/frustrated for my A-levels. Hence the grades I think.
@jonobacon Ha! We got the same grades. My A in General Studies didn't count for much.
@jamiejones85 You cunning linguist you...
@Northern_Spin1 @MarpleLeaf @editor_Maguire Incredible work chaps. Fantastic!
Any sneakerheads amongst my followers? What's your preferred cleaning/protection spray brand? Have had an absolutely awful customer service experience with one of them so looking for an alternative.
@MolloyLaurence I'm a lot more blunt than that!

@realGrandThrift It's always broken,
But I know you want one too.

Love universities.

"We're doing a project on the future of X. Not for academic purposes but to drive our strategy. Please could you contribute?"

Absolutely zero mention of a fee for what, if done right, is hours of work.

@DodoNerd I once walked in at the back of a presentation from a major consulting firm that I'd been working alongside at a client for a while. The presenter suddenly looked a little shifty. I realised why when a few slides later he presented my ideas, uncredited (on the slide).
@ianeditz Got it in 3 this morning but struggling with Quordle
@ianeditz Nooooo!
@ben_nuttall Welcome back!
@antronicsltd @DrLucyRogers My grandma once mixed up the home made playdough (salt dough) with the shortcrust for an apple pie when retrieving them from the freezer. To inedible results.
@mgcroadster @joshi Noooooo! That's rubbish news.

Well that's shitty news. We've lost an absolute legend there. Was going to see them again in April.

https://t.co/poKZWgttkB
@katebevan @mjrobbins My first thought is 'pass me the Rennie'.
@willcolumbine Ordered.
@willcolumbine I need this in my life
@jakebeldercars Excellent. Glad it's sorted.
@trent_dan I tweeted about adding some noise to my DIY EV and got really interesting responses. Some people saying "yay, safety!" and some people "boo, noise pollution!"
Just automated a boring bit of business admin and now I feel like a wizard. https://t.co/J1MZ2T6RT1

@jakebeldercars Urgh. Those days. I feel your pain. Spent about two weeks trying to remove the four little hex heads that hold in a Z3 rear axle without the benefit of much heat for fear of a fireball from the adjacent fuel tank - which also stopped me getting a drill on them.
@PhilTragenPhoto I'd pretty much exhausted every other option for that letter!
@stoopearson @apadmi Good to see you!
@dansodergren @thetrainline Got there early in the end but only by disregarding the timetable and just hoping.
Is this the ASX to the Jet Towel's ageing Galant @sniffpetrol @Carpervert? https://t.co/yefkXKXmMG

Back at the station and the information on the screen still doesn't match up with online. I'm now on a train the web was saying wouldn't arrive for another five minutes. (FYI @thetrainline) https://t.co/dw2YIzW4cG

Me: oh look, the trains are super-borked. But looks like that delayed one will leave about the same time as the one I planned to get. I'll jump on that.

Trains: SURPRISE! You didn't think the information online was actually correct did you? That one left AGES ago!
@CyclingFerret Might let something slip!
I love all my clients but just presented to perhaps the most exciting brand of my career. Going to be buzzing for days. Can't wait to shout about it.
@paulkerensa The garden centre one 👌
If you're interested in a more diverse range of views on the #future, this question sparked a fantastic thread of interesting-looking people (and particularly women) to follow.
@CKCMagazine I was reading this issue and thinking, hmmm, I really like that. Not a big 4x4 fan but that thing is cool.

@maximum_plaid I think I posted the parts saga previously. I'm normally DIY but even with Bosch's help I couldn't identify the full model number. And it was a big time sink to strip it down to replace a ~£180 part on a ~10yo machine.
@stoopearson @buzzinbee3 @McrDig @GMCAdigital @DCMS @GMWorkandSkills @UoM_CDTS See you there!
@john_p_d https://t.co/W3RY5Qixn3
@theelliebrennan LIFE CHANGING! (Though I confess, we've been getting the kids to do most of the washing up - even if we then have to re-do half of it the next day).
@FelicityHannah @SamMcAlister1 That's quite the cast!
@jacksonj04 @garyturner https://t.co/kOJWQ8qCgw
@jacksonj04 FFS!

@ClaydenChambers It does not! I looked at a couple that did but I just couldn't justify the extra cost. Was already having to compromise on energy efficiency (couldn't justify £1200+ to get an A rated model).

(In the end it just didn't make sense to fix the old one. Called a recommended local engineer and he told me it just wasn't worth it. Even if I replaced the broken part, I might only be extending its life by a year or two. So it's being taken away for recycling)
Don't mind admitting that I am excited about the arrival of our new dishwasher today after a week without one.
@sharonodea @chrisweston @SkyNews I'm sure one of my BBC friends must have played a role in that.
@friend_matt @drrosechard Lots of great female futurists! @traceyfutures @bronwynwilliams @wendyinfutures are the first three that pop into my head.
@imatherandco @McrDig Glad you enjoyed it!
This is just indescribably awful.
@russellhope @MolloyLaurence My wife's given over 8 years to that as governor, chair, and council level. I've absorbed a lot but I think we've done our bit as a household.

@davelewty My EV was only on the road a year before I took it off for upgrades so wouldn't have seen it yet I guess. 

It is different though. The schools email is totally unnecessary. The gov one at least has a purpose for registration data.
@davidmbarnett @sarajcox In retrospect she must have been wearing the world's most powerful beer goggles.
@davelewty Never seen that?

@davidmbarnett @sarajcox At a party when I was about 12, an older girl told me I looked like Mark Owen and snogged me (very much that way round).

I look *nothing* like Mark Owen. But I wasn't about to argue.
@garyturner Don't think it's that. Across two schools we've now experienced four different pretty terrible systems.
@rl_chris_higham Looks like the school is now consolidating to a single platform. Hope it's better than this one.

"Dear parent, you have arrears on your account! Please pay IMMEDIATELY!

The balance is £0.00."

Why is schools software soooo shit?
@richardfallan @SkyNews Much, much worse!

Nature of this job is that I do a *lot* of media interviews, so I don't shout about them all or this feed would be v. dull. But occasionally I grab a few & throw them up here: https://t.co/e1NrffbDpX

Latest ones include Sunday Brunch, 5live, Sky News & The Sunday Show.
Only just realised that @SkyNews called me "Tom Cheeseworth" earlier this year. 🤦 https://t.co/UmrYP6JgNI

Off to the @McrDig #MDSkillsFest this afternoon. I'm speaking at the end but I'm mostly there to listen. This is an issue in the top 3 for many of my #futurism clients and it's always good to gather other perspectives.

https://t.co/yleFBf9UlC
@pi3g @AnnaHoworth @Usborne Amazing!
@PaulDCompton1 He's brilliant
Oh, and giving feedback on whatsapped picks of potential purchases. Delighted a teenager and a tween still appreciate fashion advice from me (even if they ultimately ignore it).
@carlosludlow Thankfully they are only spending their own money!
My kids have reached the age where 'taking them shopping' means me getting a coffee and doing some work while they roam the shops.

@jmboyers Legend.

https://t.co/rETXPR3I3c
@MaffPotts I don't think it's anything sinister. Either everyone is more swamped with work, or it's just bad manners.
@KatharineQ That's the thing I don't get. All enthusiasm until I tell them a price. If it's too much for you, just say so!
@chrisweston That one Scott Mills used to give out!
@NorthernWrites Wow
@AndyMicone That's interesting. I can generally be relied on to inject a little optimism, even if I scare the pants off people first.

@mr_andyjohnson @SofiaCann1 @nickc_2 @markimark35 @amynettleton1 @lisalosardo @LisaLippett @HeidiJaneT2 @eviecopland @Sharon_marston_ @drgabywolferink @RSSS_PeteArnold @AllThingsIC @TimScottHR @KGilly9 @AsifChoudry @Fizz2701 @kerrybtonks72 Already listened to that one. It's a belter.

@JamieBGall Not sure where you're at with systems/affordability of this but I have a similar hatred of the admin of business. Three things made it bearable. Decent software (Xero/Freeagent), automated expenses (e.g. hubdoc), and a bookkeeper.

Have been ghosted by two or three people who contacted me about doing work for them so far this year. New phenomenon for me.

Has any other bad dating behaviour made it into the business realm?
@Elkinator @robinince Ha! Just around the corner if you want a coffee!

@Scrof Manchester - Dover - Calais - Reims (Bubbles) - Troyes (detour for some Chablis) - Dijon - Lyon - Clermont Ferrand (for the bridge) - Montpellier - Toulouse - Pau - Bilbao - Santander - Ferry to Portsmouth - Home.

With my mates in our #DIYEV cars (when we can charge everywhere).

@paulsng Until they start selling actual snake oil.

Wait... I'm off to recruit a couple of YouTubers and trademark that name for a new energy drink.
@Scientits Nor do most of the UK population based on my research. Average age people want to live to is 97. Though it's somewhat different in the US. More here: https://t.co/NlzgRamU7J
@brownest_Ant I wish people would stop making me want an Avantime

@MolloyLaurence Thankfully you're never more than about 5 minutes from the next 192. It's what happens on the bus you have to worry about.

Today: grown man playing Aqua's Dr Jones and some other awful eurodance at full volume from his phone
Thanks to everyone who got in touch about this. Could do a whole series on empathy now! Going to sort through all the offers and get back to everyone now.
@paulgailey @thevoltmonkey No joy
@paulgailey It's the heater element assembly. It's just a time question. It's buried right in the heart of it and the part is so expensive that it's barely worth it once you factor in the time.
@vonRunte @Aurora_KBG Thanks! This has received an incredible number of responses. Will take a look at them all and get back to you.
Five minutes after I book my train, they announce it's so delayed it won't get me to my meeting on time. Refund and off to get the bus.
@vr_sam @benz145 Superhot I reckon is up there on my list.
@realGrandThrift That's really impressive going! I'm about 100 videos in after a year and at just over 800 subs. Though always knew my content was a bit niche (DIY EV swaps).

@antronicsltd The part I think it is might be up to £180. If I have to call out an engineer, it's going to be another £100 or so. A cheap dishwasher is only about £300 and a fairly decent one £5-600. It pisses me off but I just can't justify the time and investment in repair this time.
@jmboyers Such bizarre creatures. Amazing!
@Superfast Unlike Smith & Sniff, who got inundated with pictures of car parts (mostly gearknobs) that look a little chode-y.
@aohereng The hardwired connection (too far for wireless) had been severed somewhere behind a bit of drywall. Still don't know why. Had to trace the broken bit and bypass it.
PS ideally a woman, not because it's in some way a female trait but because like all podcasts, we risk having a surfeit of men on at the moment.
Sort of #journorequest: any #pr friends represent someone who is an expert in empathy? Looking for a #podcast guest for my new season.
Or I pull the whole thing to pieces to find the problem and potentially waste a load of time.

So, they've now said my only option is to call out an engineer, since there are so many variants of this model that they can't specify the part. And they can't be sure the error code is pointing to the right part.

It's only going to be fractionally more to buy a new machine.

@MolloyLaurence I'm really hoping! Had two big work gigs not come off this week as well. Hasn't been the best. Lottery win coming up maybe?

Good news is that we have heating again.
Right, fixed it. Traced the break to the least likely place for rodent activity. Can't see it so can't be sure. Now worried about what else could have broken the cable.
@FinchPRMatt The temporary fix is going to be U G L Y
(PS no they won't talk to each other wirelessly - too much distance/noise between the two).
Small mercies: I don't have to channel out the upstairs wall again as that bit is fine. But total ballache nonetheless. Now contemplating a temporary fix to restore heating.

Of course, the place where they are broken is completely inaccessible and there is zero hope of me running a replacement that is as neatly hidden, since we've had the whole cellar boarded out since I put it in.

It turns out the wires between my Nest base unit and the controller have been completely severed. Six core cable (only needs two but it's what I had) and every single one is kaput. No continuity. Wondering if we have very quiet mice with a hunger for copper.
@BellaJanella Ooft. What a PITA
@aptshadow You've just described my first career in PR.
@BrandonJDean_ Dishwasher, thermostat, and the little heater in my workshop. Gremlins at work.
Oh good. Our thermostat has just packed up.
@idriveaclassic Bloody hell I thought the tech industry was slow to be rid of this nonsense. But it seems motorsport is trailing even further behind.
@jmboyers I've seen them in the Irish sea! They used to dive in and out of the water when I was wakeboarding off the Welsh coast as a kid.
@matthbooth This is A+++ parenting
@DodoNerd Sadly not. Spoken to them about it but it's beyond their expertise.
@thevoltmonkey Nah it's the heater element. But I just can't identify the right replacement part without the full model number. The one on the back is missing the last three digits.

Dishwasher knacked. Contact customer support because the model number has rubbed off and I can't order parts without it. Ask if there's another way to get it/place to find it.

Customer support: please send us the model number.

Me: https://t.co/XgboyFr9aT
@NCanham Ballache!

Is there an easy way to do business in the US from the UK (as a freelance speaker/writer etc)? Easier than filling out a W8 form every time, getting a B1, wrangling over taxes, exchange rates etc?  Or is that just what you need to do?
@cccalum Or d) that it's on a par with far too many humans...(which I guess is sort of a or b but perhaps speaks to the speed, and reach of said unemployment)
@dansodergren @learntheplanet @TheAHDB Cheers! Looks like a great event

@1AndrewMitchell Every now and again it just freezes at a really inopportune moment. Annoying. 

Surprised at the lack of collision detection in animations as well. Players frequently headbutting their mates in the nuts when celebrating...or maybe that's just a new celebration I haven't seen yet?
Anyone else find #FIFA23 super flaky on the #NintendoSwitch?
@MolloyLaurence @Gurdur Yep!
@chandlerye @brownest_Ant Oh now you're just tempting me.
@brownest_Ant If only they weren't such a sod to keep running (I believe) I would love one of these. Especially with an EV swap...
@gemmamilne Also @NikolasFuturist @traceyfutures @timeguide @wendyinfutures. Will think of more.
@gemmamilne 👋
Off across the Pennines tonight to meet up with some of the #DIYEV crew. Should be driving an EV-swapped taxi cab and the latest iteration of @jamiejones85' electric Beetle.
@JaneSymons1 It is very exciting! Between this and the reissue of the Book of the Future, this year is off to a very fun start.
@drunkenbutcher @frostybutcher @GrandmasSausage You must be a very popular man!
@TheCarGuru I'm not sure there's a cooler car to break down in though. Increasingly obsessed with that shape.
@drunkenbutcher Absolutely! I'll be shouting it to the moon and back (there's a clue in there as to who it might be...)

@Gurdur Thank you! Highlight of a recent telly slot here was very stylish celebs telling me they liked my matched jumper and trainers combo. That will put a smile on a portly 40-something man's face for days.
@Gurdur It is not. Come to think of it, not sure I have any clients in fashion right now. Maybe they've seen how I dress...
Have written a talk this week for a brand that I have always dreamed of working with. And even better, I'm doing a podcast episode with them, so I can tell you all about it soon.

What we don't have yet is a sponsor - or sponsors plural. 

If you're in the area of skills/#recruitment/careers advice or want to partner on some content about the #futureofwork, then drop me a line for details

Options for both season and episode sponsorship.

Just putting this out there but...

The next season of my #podcast with @kakathetiger is going to be about #skills: what you need to know to #futureproof your #career.

We already have some awesome interviews lined up and a whole 20ish episode season planned out.

1/2

PS - if you're interested in any of the above, subscribe and DM me for the relevant info. 

(Yes, I should have an automation for this but...)

Subscribers to my (roughly) fortnightly newsletter are getting a bunch of offers recently: 
 - big discount on my online course
 - early notification of free in-person events
 - 2-for-1 on tickets to #tbdconf

If you're not subscribed, check out https://t.co/lI0jnY0MsO

I'm thinking that maybe I should just reclaim the time I spend doomscrolling rather than recreate my addiction elsewhere?

Twitter is the place I've built up the biggest following. It used to drive up to half my web traffic. But recently I haven't used it to promote my work very much, and yet I'm busier than I need to be.

Mastodon is a step in that direction. Maybe I'll join it eventually. Maybe even run my own server (I have concerns about content moderation). But if Twitter goes, in some ways I'll be quite...glad? I feel something of an addiction to this place that isn't always healthy.

Not that I don't like the principle. I'm struggling to find it but I wrote a piece ages ago (maybe 2015?) about how the biggest threat to Facebook was not another social network but the basic functions of social becoming open standards like email.
This is pretty much how I feel. Which is why you won't have seen me plugging a new Mastodon address.

@timeguide Short version: I'm sure you can do it but there would likely be a large range/performance/cost penalty due to the added weight and complexity.

@timeguide Maybe. But then you're also changing all the suspension loading. Long journey is likely to be when the car is already most heavily loaded. If you're also adding a load of battery weight you might need to also reconfigure shocks/springs/tyre pressures. Doable but...
@timeguide Bit like modular phones though: it's a design limitation that prevents deeper integration/efficiency. E.g. rules out structural batteries, changes weight distribution etc

It was all driven by this report that I wrote. If you're interested in the #future of ageing and living forever: https://t.co/NlzgRamU7J

It wasn't all about concrete for me this week. I had a great chat with @CCfunkandsoul about #lifeextension and #immortality on his new @BBC6Music show on Wednesday, and even got to play some Springsteen: https://t.co/SGGsn8fYew
@TomDGreen Can't argue with your choice of fiction!

But eventually, I suspect most of us will spend ~10hrs/day in the metaverse when it is a blend of physical and digital, when it is almost transparent and the interface is semi-automated and low friction.
Don't expect all this next year. Most of my friends thought I was a weirdo for carrying a smartphone for years before the iPhone came along and they understood what it could do for them.
Will it be dominated by the same big names? Probably at first. But other big names will rise to displace them and we'll see power in the metaverse ebb and flow.

But those are concerns with the current generation of tech, and I think you have to be hugely biased not to consider the internet a net win for humanity. The metaverse will have all the same problems x10 but I still think the benefits will outweigh them.

It will feed information through all our senses and collect it from our environment, our bodies and even our minds. Will it be invasive? Totally! Are people right to have concerns about disconnection with the physical world? Absolutely.
It won't be *more* cumbersome than phone-based social media, it will be less. We don't have the tech or the interface design yet but ultimately it will be slick, intuitive and (almost) always-on.
You know how we all laugh at those stories about people who dismissed the internet or the web as fads? I have a strong suspicion that eventually we'll be doing the same with the metaverse.

@t0nyyates Agree. For me it's a choice between slow and poorly targeted measures nationally vs potentially inefficient local spending that risks increasing inequality between regions. I'd narrowly plump for the latter but not without concerns.
@tprstly Then narrowly Cognac, but ideally Armagnac.
@tprstly Why either/or?

If instead (and better), we are to move to a more distributed grid, we need to invest in the networks to make them fit for purpose and create incentives to lower demand and bring on new capacity in generation and storage.

If we are going to stick primarily with centralised generation and distribution, we need large scale investment in cleaner generating capacity and storage. I don't see that coming from the private sector.

Simply put, the answer is underinvestment. New national energy infrastructure requires very large amounts of capital with very long returns. The sort of investment that is well suited to states but less well suited to the private sector, at least in its current shape.

So why haven't we? Why are prices spiking so high they are driving companies out of business? Why are we still firing up ancient coal plants to keep the lights on?
https://t.co/hSk8QuMxAV

Back to 2016 and the no. 1 pressure we highlighted in this report for CMS was fuel security. "The UK needs to find more dependable domestic energy sources", we said.
https://t.co/THvXFmPMCV.

“We may see some tight margins again this winter, but we’re confident there’ll be enough electricity to keep Britain’s lights on,” National Grid ESO said in a statement.

Which sounds a lot like: "We have complete confidence in the manager..."
The margin improved after that but this year the low end forecasts are back at the same level: https://t.co/YZ3rJ33nEy
In July 2015, I wrote this piece after the projected margin had narrowed even further to just 1.2%: https://t.co/8Z53dePcNt
Economics 101 will tell you a narrow margin between supply and demand will only do one thing to prices.
In October 2014, I wrote about the decline of our domestic electricity generating capacity and the thin margins between supply and demand: https://t.co/4M1jVropHA
